page.title: 01Threekingham & Spanby
page.content: Threekingham village used to stand astride the A52 road but was by passed about 10 years ago. The ancient pub is struggling to attract custom. The residents complain that the village streets are too narrow for modern farm machinery. There are also complaints about the villages only industry, a tyre remould factory. The village is trying to raise money to buy land for a playing field. The hamlet of Spanby to the North comprises of a few cottages and agricultural holdings. The farm at the corner of Mareham Lane concentrates on 'Pick your own' fruit and vegetables. The Clay soil of the area is divided into medium sized fields by thorn hedges. The crops are cerials, sugar beet potatoes & oilseed rape with two blocks of conifirous woodland on white house farm. For those people who rely on public
